net.sf.opengroove.client.notification
Interface TaskbarNotification

All Known Implementing Classes:
NotificationAdapter, ToolNotification, UpdateNotification, WorkspaceNotification
public interface TaskbarNotification

Author:
Alexander Boyd

Method Summary
 void clicked()
          called when this alert is clicked.
 Component getComponent()
          this method should return the component that should be placed in the notification frame.
 boolean isAlert()
          returns true if this is an alert.
 boolean isOneTimeOnly()
          returns true if this alert is one time only.
 void mouseOut()
          called when the mouse moves out of this alert.
 void mouseOver()
          called when the mouse moves over this alert.
 

Method Detail

getComponent

Component getComponent()
this method should return the component that should be placed in the notification frame. it is imperative that this method return the same component each time this method is called. it is also imperative that the component never change size.

Returns:

isAlert

boolean isAlert()
returns true if this is an alert. if this is an alert, the taskbar icon will flash while this is in the notification frame. basically, an alert is intended to alert the user that they need to click on the component, for example, a message has been received. an example of a NON alert would be a notification about that the message is in progress of sending to someone else.

Returns:

isOneTimeOnly

boolean isOneTimeOnly()
returns true if this alert is one time only. If an alert is one time only, then it will be removed from the TaskbarNotificationFrame when it fades out. an example of a one time only alert might be that so-and-so has just come online.

Returns:

clicked

void clicked()
called when this alert is clicked. the component returned from getComponent() has a mouse listener added to it and when it is clicked then this method is called. an alternate way to listen for click events would be to add a mouse listener to the component returned yourself.

mouseOver

void mouseOver()
called when the mouse moves over this alert.

mouseOut

void mouseOut()
called when the mouse moves out of this alert.
